Sequence Information.Function: Probably participates in a plant defense mechanism. Has antibiotic activity. Inhibits the cytopathic effects and replication of the human immunodeficiency virus. Active against the Gram-positive S.aureus with a minimum inhibition concentration of approximately 0.2 microM. Relatively ineffective against Gram-negative bacteria such as E.coli and P.aeruginosa.

Literature.Title: Circulins A and B: novel HIV-inhibitor macrocyclic peptide from tropical tree Chassalia parvifolia.
Literature.Author: Kashman Y.,Parson I.C.,Henderson L.E.,Sowder R.C. II,Gustafson K.R.

Literature.Title: Analysis of the disulfide linkage pattern in circulin A and B, HIV-inhibitory macrocyclic peptides.
Literature.Author: Pannell L.K.,Gustafson K.R.,Derua R.

Literature.Title: An unusual structural motif of antimicrobial peptides containing end-to-end macrocycle and cystine-knot disulfides.
Literature.Author: Chiu K.-W.,Yang J.-L.,Lu Y.-A.,Tam J.P.

Literature.Title: Solution structure by NMR of circulin A: a macrocyclic knotted peptide having anti-HIV activity.
Literature.Author: Casas-Finet J.R.,Boyd M.R.,Gustafson K.R.,Koltay A.,Daly N.L.
